lead_paragraph: Facing a budget shortfall wider than ever before encountered by a state, the government of California has been plunged into a deep crisis that many lawmakers say could force a fundamental restructuring of government in the nation's most populous state. Gov. Pete Wilson, a Republican, huddled with legislative leaders of both parties today at the Capitol in Sacramento to confront a gap of $12.6 billion between spending and expected revenue in the state's budgets for this fiscal year and the next.

headline.main: California's Fiscal Crisis Tests Government's Role

byline.original: By ROBERT REINHOLD, Special to The New York Times
